page.title: 0975 Years of Guiding
page.content: 75 years ago in 1910,the guiding movement started. Earlier,boys had become Scouts,and girls had the urge to enjoy similar activities. It was organised by Robert Baden-Powell,later Lord Baden-Powell. The uniform now consists of a blue shirt and skirt with a coloured scarf held by a plaited leather woggle. Our company is organised by an adult called 'Dove'. She is helped by another Guider who we call 'Acorn'. The age range for Guides is 10 to 14 years. They can go on camps where they have to look after themselves and cook their own food. They sometimes have toasted marshmallows around a campfire and sing songs. To celebrate the 75 years,a flame was carried from London to Guide companies all over the country.
